intro: Lepigonum melanospermum, commonly known as blackseed foxglove, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant produces small, dark seeds that are encased in a hard, black seed coat. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Lepigonum melanospermum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
